page.title: 13FELIXKIRK GUN CLUB.
page.content: Felixkirk gun club has been in existance for 12 years. It is situated in a field well away from house in the village. At present the premises are being refurbished. A large car park has been laid and thousands of pounds have been spent on automatic equipment for projecting the saucer shaped clay pigeons. The 80 members of the club are drawn from all walks of life and are not just local people. Some come as far away as Teeside, Leeds, Harrogate, Boroughbridge to do their shooting. The club is divided into 3 sections; the Cleveland League with 30 members and Open Practice with 20 members and Local Section numbering 30 members mainly older people not wishing to travel to competitions.
